#Text=United States :
#Text=Two killed , more than a hundred injured in Amtrak train collision in South Carolina
#Text=Wednesday , February 7 , 2018

#Text=Early on Sunday morning , Amtrak 's passenger train number 91 , the Silver Star , bound for Miami from New York , slammed into a stationary CSX freight train in Cayce , about ten miles ( 16 km ) south of Columbia , capital of the US state of South Carolina .
#Text=Two Amtrak employees were killed and at least 116 were injured , some seriously .
#Text=File photo of an Amtrak Silver Star locomotive , 2012 .
#Text=Image : Walter .
#Text=The two killed were 54-year-old engineer Michael Kempf of Savannah , Georgia , and 36-year-old conductor Michael Cella of Orange Park , Florida .

#Text=Robert Sumwalt , chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board , told a press conference the passenger train had been diverted into a siding by a switch left " literally locked , with a padlock " in that position .
#Text=The collision happened at about 2:35 am local time ( 0735 UTC ) at a switching yard in the small city of Cayce .
#Text=The Amtrak train , with reportedly 139 passengers and eight employees aboard , collided head on with the freight train , which was parked with no one on board .
#Text=The Amtrak locomotive and the leading locomotive on the freight train were destroyed ; the Amtrak locomotive and some of its passenger cars derailed , and one of those cars was folded in half .
#Text=Several freight cars were crumpled , Reuters reported .

#Text=In a press conference , the state governor , Henry McMaster , said the Amtrak locomotive was " barely recognizable " and described it as " a horrible thing to see , to understand the force involved " .

#Text=Harrison Cahill , a spokesman for Lexington County , gave a count of 116 injured , up from an initial report of 70 ; according to Derrec Becker , public information officer for the South Carolina Emergency Management Division , injuries ranged " from cuts and bruises to severe broken bones " .
#Text=On Monday a Palmetto Health spokesperson said two patients were in serious and two in critical condition at their facilities .
#Text=A spill of approximately 5,000 gallons of fuel from the freight train posed no safety hazard , according to officials .
#Text=Passenger Derek Pettaway told the CNN network that like most others , he had been sleeping when the collision happened .
#Text=He said Amtrak staff cleared the passengers from the train rapidly , and there was no panic ; " I think people were more in shock than anything else " , he said .
#Text=" Key to this investigation is learning why the switch was lined that way " , Sumwalt said .

#Text=Amtrak 's CEO , Richard Anderson , speaking to reporters on Sunday , held CSX responsible ; he stated the track in that area is operated by CSX and the signals , which CSX operates , were not working at the time of the collision and a CSX dispatcher was therefore directing the Amtrak train 's movements .
#Text=Sumwalt noted an automatic monitoring and braking system called positive train control , which was not in use on the stretch of line , could have forestalled the collision .
#Text=Several fatal incidents involving Amtrak trains have occurred in the past three months .
#Text=On December 18 , the inaugural train on a new route in Washington state derailed at high speed while crossing above a highway , killing three ;
#Text=on January 31 , the driver of a garbage truck was killed in Virginia when he collided with an Amtrak train chartered to take Republican lawmakers to a retreat .
